dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4464 IH: Restore Agricultural Investment, Stability, and Expansion Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Wasserman Schultz (for herself, Mr. C. Scott Franklin of Florida, Mr. Soto, and Mrs. Cammack) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Agricultural Act of 2014 to authorize emergency assistance for high value crop losses, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Restore Agricultural Investment, Stability, and Expansion Act of 2023 or the RAISE Act of 2023.

section.header: Emergency assistance for high value crop losses
section.text: Subtitle E of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (7 U.S.C. 9081 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Emergency assistance for high value crop losses

subsection.text: The Secretary may carry out a program to make payments to producers of high value crops (including citrus) for losses of revenue or losses of quality or production of such crops as a consequence of a drought, wildfire, hurricane, flood, derecho, excessive heat, tornado, winter storm, freeze (including a polar vortex), smoke exposure, or excessive moisture.
The program established pursuant to subsection (a) may be carried out through block grants to States and territories.
